intro: Argostemma humifusum, commonly known as the creeping argostemma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows close to the ground, with its stems spreading horizontally and forming a dense mat. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters and are often accompanied by opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
